revision.text:
{{WPMILHIST|class=start|Middle-Eastern=yes}} {{WikiProject Palestine|class=start|importance=Mid}} What was the second half of the operation, the half that failed? Was it to take the tel-aviv area or reach Jerusalem? <small>—The preceding [[Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|unsigned]] comment was added by [[User:Greenpixie|Greenpixie]] ([[User talk:Greenpixie|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Greenpixie|contribs]]) 00:54, 29 May 2006.</small><!-- Template:Unsigned -->
== External links ==
I have restored the two following links:
* [http://www.palestineremembered.com/al-Ramla/al-Ramla/index.html al-Ramla: The Home Town of Khalil al-Wazir, Abu Jihad] * [http://www.jerusalemites.org/crimes/destroyed_villages/47.htm Destroyed villages: Al-Latrun]
There is no reason why only Israeli and US Zionist sources should be given.
If you think there is any reason that these links should be removed, please give your reasons and don't remove them before this issue is resolved (see also the discussions on [[Talk:Moshe_Sharett#Dubious_link|Moshe_Sharett]] and [[Talk:David_Ben-Gurion#Removing_links|David_Ben-Gurion]]). —[[User:Babelfisch|Babelfisch]] 07:56, 3 November 2006 (UTC) If you think there is any reason that these links should be removed, please give your reasons and don't remove them before this issue is resolved. —[[User:Babelfisch|Babelfisch]] 07:56, 3 November 2006 (UTC) :As I have explained on many pages already, these are personal websites filled with Original research and propaganda. They should not be included under [[WP:EL]]. The issue is not the politics of the sites, but the quality. Until you can explain who runs those websites, and in what way they are not personal website, please do not restore them again, and please stop [[Wikipedia:Harassment|Wikistalking]] and reverting me. [[User:Jayjg|Jayjg ]]<sup><small><font color="DarkGreen">[[User_talk:Jayjg|(talk)]]</font></small></sup> 08:00, 3 November 2006 (UTC)
:: I disagree with you, I'm not harressing you. :: These sites don't violate any Wikipedia policies. —[[User:Babelfisch|Babelfisch]] 07:29, 7 November 2006 (UTC) :You keep repeating yourself, but you haven't refuted my arguments, nor have you been able to provide any information about exactly who is running those personal websites/blogs. [[User:Jayjg|Jayjg ]]<sup><small><font color="DarkGreen">[[User_talk:Jayjg|(talk)]]</font></small></sup> 17:30, 13 November 2006 (UTC)
== Local militia attackes? ==
I have never heard this before, and I've read quite a bit on the subject. Please provide references that show the expulsion was not pre-meditated. <small>—Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/216.189.164.86|216.189.164.86]] ([[User talk:216.189.164.86|talk]]) 04:29, 6 November 2007 (UTC)</small><!-- Template:UnsignedIP --> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->
==[[Exodus from Lydda]]== Someone has posted a tag on that article saying it should be merged into this one, and that it should be discussed here. I oppose the merge proposal, in part because Operation Danny was about more than just Lydda and Ramla; and in part because the expulsions from those cities is an issue in its own right. <font color="green">[[User:SlimVirgin|SlimVirgin]]</font> <small><sup><font color="red">[[User_talk:SlimVirgin|talk|]]</font><font color="pink">[[Special:Contributions/SlimVirgin|contribs]]</font></sup></small> 20:05, 7 May 2009 (UTC)
:Most certainly oppose the merge. Exodus from Lydda deserves to be in its own article, especially considering the large size it has reached now. --Sherif9282 15:42, 8 May 2009 (UTC)
::I oppose the merge for exactly the reasons above.[[User:Padres Hana|Padres Hana]] ([[User talk:Padres Hana|talk]]) 18:28, 11 May 2009 (UTC)
==Map==
I take care of this. [[User:Ceedjee|Ceedjee]] ([[User talk:Ceedjee|talk]]) 06:39, 19 May 2009 (UTC)
